reviews.title: Ultra-relaxing girl's day out
text: We came for a much-needed day of rest and relaxation, and couldn't have been happier with the service and facilities. It was perhaps the best facial I've ever had  and the body polish and massage were very soothing. Lunch was a very filling and delicious salad and a glass of wine - gelato was also offered but the salad was plenty. The pool area was wonderful, especially on a cold wintery day - it was as warm and humid as a trip to the tropics and felt like a true vacation. I will be back!

reviews.title: Disappointed
text: Left feeling disappointed. Massage was just ok and she talked all the way through. I said I was there to relax. Body polish felt good but room was freezing. Facial just ok. Staff was pleasant. But…. There was some sort of class in the pool when I arrived. Hot tub is small and 2 people already in it. Sauna looked like a small portable one. 2 people in it and it was full. Lunch was a joke. Salad with a small piece of salmon. Prosecco showed up half way through. Asked for napkin and never did get one. This was $35!! No coffee or dessert. I was still hungry after. Thought I would try the hot tub and sauna after treatments but 2 people in each and no room for me so I left. $530 was too much for this even in Toronto.

reviews.title: Lovely but a couple of reco's
text: My girl friends bought be a gc to the spa (paraffin mani & pedi) and I added on a facial and time in the water area. My apt was 11:45am water (1hr), then 1 hr facial  followed by 1 hr each mani & pedi.
1. The lemon water wasn't cold - a few ice cubes in the water jug would enhance the drink
2. A very loud guest was there talking on her cell phone and then complained about the food - please help keep the relaxing couch areas as quiet as possible for others.
- Said person ended up having her mani & pedi at the same time as me and didn't stop complaining about her life and wouldn't stop talking.

3. No where on the website does it mention that food is an option - unless you're booking a package (comes with lunch). I was dying of hunger by the time my treatments had ended. I only found out there was a meal option as I heard that person complaining. Based on my apt scheduling it would have been nice to be advised that lunch was recommended. I could have brought a snack I supposed but the added suggestion would have gone a long way with customer service. :)
I would go back but would have lunch too :).

reviews.title: Much needed fabulous day
text: Drove a couple of hours into the city and this spa did not disappoint!  The beautiful lounge area provided such a retreat feel I could have hung out there all day, next time I am going to bring a book and take advantage of the serenity.  The pool and jacuzzi also provides a quiet area to lounge.  I thoroughly enjoyed my pedicure and parafin treatment, Natasha has a super personality.  My aunt had a facial with Robby and had the same great experience with her service.  I cannot truly describe the peace I felt while I was there, for someone who has a great deal of difficulty slowing down, my mind actually settled.  It was a great experience overall and I cannot wait to go back!

reviews.title: Not so great an experience
text: I went to the Spa today for a message and was disappointed. The massage was very average and the experience left me wondering why I was paying so much money for such mediocrity.  I requested a specific area for relieving stress (my neck),but it was barely covered. The pressure was so low  even after requesting for more pressure, there was none. All in all, very very disappointing. Will definitely not got there again! And I was charged for 75 mins when the masseuse stopped after 65 mins! Please don't waste your money

reviews.title: One of the most relaxing spa experiences in Torono
text: I booked a facial and it was one of the best I had. It was quiet, the room was dark, the music was relaxing and the esthetician had a magical touch. I fell asleep!
The facial included a foot massage that was amazing.
When you come to the spa, you can access the pool and other services. Bring your swimsuit and take your time.

reviews.title: Worst spa experience and a bride’s worst nightmare
text: The worst spa experience. I brought my friend there for a relaxing spa day as part of a bachelorette party and it was the worst mistake. They messed up both on her nails, my nails and on all of the bridesmaids’ individual bills. We asked them to split the bride’s bill for us so we can cover her costs and they for some reason would not give us a receipt with a proper breakdown of costs. They made a bunch of mistakes during the whole experience. They gave me regular polish when I booked shellac. I had told them it’s okay, just make sure I’m not charged with shellac but they charged me anyway. The nail salon gave the bride instructions to wait an hour for her nails to dry and 20-30 min for my nails to dry. We both waited one hour before showering and of course the nails were scratched up and dented afterwards. They don’t have the proper equipment in their nail salon because typically nail technicians put your nails under a fan to dry but they didn’t. They asked the bride to come back to get it fixed but refused to hold a spot for her the next day unless she could confirm her schedule on the spot (the bride lives an hour and a half away and it’s the week of her wedding so she would need time to re-arrange her schedule to make it happen). They said it would be “taking away” from another customer if they held the spot for her and she wasn’t able to make it, even though their mistake is the reason why she needed to come back in the first place. When I checked my bill I told the front desk that my meal is charged incorrectly because it seemed like a lot more than what I ordered. She kept insisting it was correct without actually checking. Finally, I told her I didn’t mean to be difficult, but just wanted to be sure and asked to look at the lunch menu again and found out that they had indeed charged me with the wrong meal. She then proceeded and said, “well, what you had on your plate was this salad instead”, even though I repeatedly told her I had ordered the daily salad and asked if the amount was correct. At that point it seemed like she was just trying to argue back to defend herself from upset customers who were rightfully disappointed. She then accused me of lying when I told her that the nail technician told me to wait 20-30 min even though I waited an hour before taking a shower and said that she had spoken to the technician and was told a different story. I asked her what the technician told her and she refused to explain. Again, a proper nail salon should have a fan to dry the nails but this one didn’t have one for some reason even though the service is not cheap at all. We ended up staying there all day to get the bills sorted out properly and for the bride to finally get her nails fixed. Having to deal with this poor service took so much time that it actually cut into the other activities we had planned for the bride’s relaxing day. I would highly discourage anyone from going there.

reviews.title: Great relaxing Saturday !
text: Spa Day, message, facial, and champagne. Clean, great message, and fun deco.

Women's only is nice, adult only is nice. Tread mill and bike in pool, very relaxing pool area. Area is a little out dated, and not your typical luxury spa area, but good value for a really good massage. Treatments were booked , but the spa didn't seem overly busy, very large underground space.

reviews.title: Horrible customer service
text: Horrible and rude front desk staff. Booked spa day for myself and a friend. Day before spa friend went to emergency for an unexpected medical issue. Called to cancel 23 hours prior to appointments. They said i would still incur the full charges as i was not the one sick and they must have 24 hours notice!!!!! Was worried for friend and may have had to assist if things were not well. Talk about a stressful start to a spa day. Not what we had in mind at all. Friend even offered to pay for pool access while i had my treatments however even then the receptionist said no as need to book $100 minimum for access. Friend was able to come and get a modified treatment as she was a trooper and didn’t want me to get charged but manager only said girl at desk was new and did not even offer a complimentary coffee or tea as compensation for the stress.  Maybe some sensitivity training for new staff would help. Not an excuse. This spa was a recommendation from some regulars who will NOT return after this . Focus should be customers not bottom line. Not recommend as they are not at all accommodating or empathetic.

reviews.title: Disappointing Spa, Front Desk in particular rude, comically slow, unprofessional
text: Disappointing experience.  On the positive side, the massage was decent and the lounge had a certain low-key charm.  The water therapies are a bit dated and limited to be sure, but honestly the front desk staff was what made a "meh" experience absolutely unacceptable (particularly at the price).

The receptionist/front desk person managed to ignore me for 15 minutes when I was trying to check in -- there were zero other customers, but apparently even a nod or a "just a moment please" was too much to expect as she continued on the phone for 15 mins while I was standing right in front of her.

The checkout was actually comical it was so bad - several guests were waiting to checkout and the front desk seem to continue to go as slow as possible, ignoring the number of people waiting.  I actually went back to the lounge to sit for 15-20 mins, came back, and the same people were still waiting.  It ended up taking close to 30-35 minutes before I could check out (no acknowledgement of the wait, nothing except annoyance at having to check me out).  Then getting the RMT receipt took 3 different tries - the staff member handed me a half-filled oddly informal receipt (missing amount, missing date, missing invoice number, nevermind missing any official stamp/logo/spa indicator).  When I asked if she could fill it in fully, I got a stare then an exasperated sigh, and she added the date and handed it back.  I pointed out that several fields were still missing, could she fill them in? Rinse and repeat 3 separate times.

Really surprisingly bad service especially galling at $200+ for a simple massage, really unacceptable.  Reading some of the other reviews on Google reviews etc, it seems this wasn't a one-off bad day for the front-desk staff either.  So many better options in downtown Toronto for nice spas with competent and pleasant service - will be avoiding this place from now on.

reviews.title: Beautiful Spa, would return again
text: I took my mom to this spa as a gift.  We each had a facial and leg treatment.  I loved the atmosphere of the spa.  It is calm and relaxing.  We went mid-week, in the morning so keep in mind it was pretty quiet when we were there.

They provide you with robes, sandals, toothbrush and toothpaste in your locker.  The locker room is small (glad it was not busy when we were there), but clean, nice big showers, equipped with hair dryers etc.

The lounge area was nice and relaxing with big chairs, couches, tables, coffee, water and tea.  We were escorted to the beautiful large pool area, very serene again with nice arm chairs, magazines etc.  The pool is chest height, perfect for relaxing.  We also used the hot tub.

We both really enjoyed our facials and leg treatments.  The ladies had slightly different techniques, but we both raved about them.  It was 90 mins of amazing relaxation, and a bit of added massage with it for myself.  They do try and sell their skincare line that they use on you (which is customized for your skin type) but I didn't feel pressured at all to purchase it.
We were told to relax as long as we liked before and after and enjoy ourselves.
I will 100% return to this spa again in the future and recommend it.

reviews.title: Massive spa... dirty steam room
text: I am know for being blunt and honest with my reviews. While the staff were amazing and the space was huge I just couldn't get into the temperatures of the water. The pool was too cool, the hot tub way too hot and the infra red sauna too cool... I felt like I was Goldilocks trying to find the right fit. Personally I like the Body Blitz on King East better and it's half the price on Cheap Tuesdays. I have to note the steam room in the change room was really dirty and had mould everywhere, guessing that's not the safest place to sit in for extended periods of time!

reviews.title: Lovely!
text: Relaxation, beauty, indulgence - this spa has it all.  My mother and i went together for her 79th birthday, and were pampered like princesses. We enjoyed therapeutic massages and body scrubs, both of which were very professional and relaxing.  The beautiful pool (filtered without chlorine) and the jacuzzi were particularly pleasant.  All in all, a lovely oasis in the busy city!

reviews.title: Massage, swim and tea afternoons
text: I have only visited the spa for massages, which come with the offer of using their pool & sauna facilities for as long as you like, in addition to just chilling out with a book/tea for as long as you like also.  So, a pretty good deal considering you are just paying for a massage and you can make quite a time of it.  The amenities are quite nice as a non-member and everyone is super-friendly and customer oriented.  My fave masseuse is Suzanne; she really gets in there if you want and also leaves you alone to your personal bliss during the massage without you feeling badly about not talking.  I return as often as my budget/benefits permit ...

reviews.title: Great massage - everything else...just ok
text: A girlfriend & I took a day off to have treatments at Sweetgrass: my friend did the Staycation - massage & facial, and I did a massage and mani/pedi.
I have to give this spa a very mixed review:

Pros:  Both of our massages were absolutely fantastic! One of the better massages both of us have had.  My friend also loved her facial.  She thought the esthetician was extremely attentive and had nothing but praises for the treatment.  The lobby and lounge area are very pretty.  All of the staff were lovely and attentive. It was lovely to sit with glasses of wine in the lounge after our treatments.

Cons:  The mani-pedi was ruined before I even left the spa.  I have to say that this is the 2nd time I've had a mani-pedi in a high-end spa where they don't put dryers on, and only use the spray, and both times I've found this highly ineffective.  My nails were not close to being dry though I was very careful.

The spa was also not nearly as 'swanky' as I would have expected, particularly as the spa is within a very exclusive women's club.  Tiny change room.  The hydrotherapy was not so great - I can't believe people pay $50 for it without treatments.  The whirlpool had tons of foam which we weren't sure was  residue from other clients body lotions or whether it was supposed to be there.  The tiny sauna, just sitting on the pool deck looked cheap...and the worst part - it was so loud in the pool - not because of customers, but from the spa's own 'lifeguard/instructor' teaching a private lesson during our lounging time.  I tried to sleep in a lounge chair & was woken up from her yelling!

Upon leaving, we were surprised when my friend's visa gift card was declined several times.  We found out later, from calling visa, that the gift card, when used in a spa must be charged for a cost lower than the card's value, so one cannot top up the card's value with cash.  (so if the treatment is $300, the spa cannot enter a $200 Visa gift card against the fee & allow the guest to pay the extra $100.) Not the spa's fault, but I'm surprised that a spa wouldn't know this information.  One would think that they would be a destination for Visa gift card users.....
I would return for a massage, and my friend would return for both massage and facial.  However, I think both of us would be in & out, without spending time in the waters or 'laying about'.

reviews.title: A true oasis
text: My boyfriend gave me the best gift a girl could ask for...an "all about me" day (as the package is called) at SweetGrass spa.
Every woman knows how personal of an experience a spa day is and how difficult it is to find a place that's 5-stars across the board. Well this place has done it!
It's warm, welcoming, down-to-earth, and relaxing environment is exactly what I was looking for.

Every member of the staff is extremely attentive and strives to create the best experience. My services with Veronica (massage), Belona (facial), and Ashley (mani/pedi) were all top-notch, informative, and relaxing. Even the manager, Monique, was readily available to answer any questions and extended great customer service.

In addition to all that, who doesn't like to cuddle up on a comfy couch in a comfy robe, warm tea in hand after a delicious lunch and glass of champagne (part of package) waiting for their next pampering service?
If anyone is looking for a truly quiet, clean, and relaxing experience I highly recommend this spa.
I look forward to returning!

reviews.title: LOVE this spa! Truly Pampered!
text: Really enjoyed this find in Toronto! Luxurious space, beautiful pool and the smell of roses is divine. One of the best lounging urban spas i have been to. The women's only atmosphere also makes it different. You feel pampered and the staff is very attentive. Our therapists were true professionals and knew what they were doing. Wish i could have stayed for a glass of wine :) What a treat!

reviews.title: Overpriced for the Value
text: After visiting several spas in the city, this spa was a huge let-down. The pool area itself is grim. The paint colours are dated and lack a sense of serenity you would want to experience at a spa. The pool was a tad too cold but the hot tub didn't feel hot enough. The sauna is a joke. You had to wait for it to heat up from room temperature while you sad in a box with a glass front wall enclosure. I felt like I was staying at an airbnb yet paying for a 4-Star hotel.
The staff were nice and I felt like my massage therapist cared about the work she did, but that didn't mean that the treatment was worth what I paid for.
I really wanted to like this place but it was really disappointing.

reviews.title: eyelash extensions
text: I've been to Sweetgrass several times but mostly for eyelash extensions. They do a good job though pricier than other places. I've tried their pool and mani/pedi but I dont think they were spectacular. But I'd keep going for the eyelash extensions, though. The service has consistently been good and I wouldnt mind trying out other services at some point.

reviews.title: seen better
text: went to celebrate my friends wedding

Massages were average, RMT was available- The lunch was good, serving is very small- we order from menu verse lunch special as it was better pricing and more selection-  service inside the spa was great very attentive-

reviews.title: Do not recommend
text: This place had a lovely vibe to it, staff was very friendly, and the smoke salmon salad was lovely however, the pedicure treatment itself was probably the worse one I have ever received (also maybe the most expensive). No hot wax was provided in the pedicure deal which was very expensive therefore, you think it would have been. The room lighting was dark therefore, I thought I had selected a pink but instead it was an orange. No massage chairs, instead sitting was quite uncomfortable with no head rest. After awaiting the completion of my friends pedicure, waiting for lunch, then consuming lunch I had a perfect pedicure however, I awoke the next morning to my pedicure looking terrible - along with my friends as well (evidently it was not dry but we did not understand how it could not have been dry after at least 2 hours) in which this has never happened to me before.  Overall, very disappointed with this spa, mainly due to the fact that it is a higher end spa, with higher prices yet the end result was the result of a cheap spa experience.

reviews.title: Great day at the spa
text: I have no previous spa experience but read the reviews and decided that SweetGrass had the perfect package for my spa treat.  Here are my overall thoughts.

I found a general lack of information given prior to showing up.  Didn't know if there was shampoo/soap/blow dryers available (all of the above and more was provided).  I didn't find the website to be as informative as some other local spa websites in terms of what to bring and spa etiquette/tipping policies.

I wish that I could have organized my spa services a little differently.  It was just bad planning to have a mani/pedi as the last service if you have any intention of using the pool/jacuzzi.  On to the services,  Tammy gave me a wonderful facial, Leda  was fabulous for my body glow treatment and my massage would have been fine had it not been for the construction crew hammering outside while I tried to relax.  Lunch was good and even though there were lots of people that day, I rarely saw anybody and it didn't feel crowded at all.  I would like to suggest that the spa considers getting a keurig or nespresso machine because the coffee definitely needs improvement.  Overall i was very satisfied and would return.

reviews.title: Why the rave reviews?
text: Is it because there are few other options? The spa is well maintained but old and dim. The nail services are not great. Shellac manicures don't last and the cleanliness is not clear. When we asked we were told that the tolls were cleaned but only put in cleansers and in the autoclave "sometimes".... Lunch is available but expensive and manicure clients aren't offered tea or welcomed with enthusiasm....even though we were there as a group for a special occasion.

reviews.title: Destination Divas Spa Day!
text: Group Spa Day for our annual divas destination vacation was here. Very nice spa and setup the members locker room is separate from the guest locker room. If you spend a certain amount you'll have access to the pool jacuzzi and sauna also. I would consider it more of a bath house. I received a facial, and 60 min massage. The facial was basic but good and she was very knowledgable about my skins habits and condition. The massage was ok. Not the best ever and not the worse ever. I asked for deep but it felt more Swedish. But the techs were extremely friendly and polite.

reviews.title: Beautiful Spa, Great Service!
text: I was pleasantly surprised by how wonderful this spa was. I booked a massage but also had lunch and did hydrotherapy (pool, hot tub, infrared sauna.) I would most definitely return to this spot and highly recommend it.  The prices are fair and the services wonderful. The staff is very friendly and helpful.

reviews.title: A pamper day
text: The SPA was recommended to me by a local Torontonian as I wanted to spend the day indulging and recuperating before a week of wedding celebrations.

As someone who works very hard, I regularly take time out to try and relax and live in the moment. This was the perfect place to do this...I love my massage, my reflexology, my mani and pedi and then my facial... It was blissful.
Slightly expensive but worth it in the end.

reviews.title: Incredible massage, everything else just ok
text: If I could gets the same massage therapist at a different place that would be ideal. The place is cute with a pink and feminine lounge.

Pool area is definitely dated, but fine. They could use hooks on the walls to hang your robes/towels. The portable sauna was disappointing, it is literally a display case you sit in that doesn't get to a decent sauna temp or feel, no options for different seat levels.

Overall I was very relaxed and the massage was absolutely incredible. My massage therapist was professional, listened to my needs and would highly recommend. But at $165 for an hour massage, the added "spa" benefits were not worth it.
Undecided if I will return.

reviews.title: Been to better
text: Today I visited this spa for the first time and honestly didn’t think much of it. I have been to better and cheaper too. Anyway

- when I arrived I was immediately shown a locker and got my robe and slippers. Staff was professional and courteous. Told me to go to the lounge and would have a form for me to fill in. Realized after she left I didn’t know where the lounge is. The place is a bit of a maze with lots of doors most of which are unmarked. Anyway found lounge. Girl took my form and left. No tour. No indication of what happens next ie is this where my therapist would collect me? (Answer yes)

- the lounge was cozy although busy with staff passing back and forth all the time (didn’t see a lot of clients). It’s a dark pinkish color with pipes guvhbg an industrial feel ceiling. You can tell it’s in the basement. Lots of chairs and tables to lounge in. No clock. So eventually I go ask for a tour as I have no idea where the pool is. The lounge has water teas and coffee available round one of its corners (not instantly obvious either). Selection of magazines. Wine menu for sale on each table. No sign of a lunch menu but it’s 11.30am so too early?

- the pool is as pictured in reviews. A very warm room a bit dark and dated colors and the pool is a murky green. In the basement too so no windows and again a touch of an industrial feel. Wasn’t appealing. There is an underwater treadmill and bike in it which is cool. A good selection of pool loungers.

I hear a cough and sneeze and then the massage therapist Melanie appeared. Don’t love being massaged by a sick person but she insisted she was almost over it as she shook my hand with a painfully strong grip.  The massage rooms are spartan but functional and after we had agreed on a lighter pressure, the warm stone massage was quite good (although still hard pressure at times). Nice use of stones and hot towels.

After my massage I had the express pedicure which said 45 mins but was more like 30. It was a choice between callus removal or cuticle work and I chose the former but really she could have done both in the time instead of cut it short. Seemed hygienic enough and she did a good job. At this point it was 1.15pm so I asked Bobbi about lunch menu and she said it was too late kitchen was closed?? I never saw anyone eating so wonder if they even do food anymore. I was hungry at this point and had planned to stay the afternoon but no food was a deal breaker. So I went home a bit disappointed.

reviews.title: Great Experience!
text: I was so happy to find this place and found the amenities and staff to be truly amazing.  Not sure what the negative reviews are about - the pool is huge and very nice, the infrared sauna, though small, was top quality and gave me an amazing sweat, the massage was wonderful.  AND you can order food from one of Toronto's top restaurants and have it delivered post-treatment.  Complimentary coffee, wine, and tea.  Beautiful, spacious change rooms.  Was having trouble adjusting to the TO cold and walking in here totally saved me!!

reviews.title: Do not waste your money
text: I went because there was a last minute massage sale. The massage was pretty good. However the amenities are pathetic. A small, grim swimming pool, a hot tub and a tiny portable sauna. They also don't allow nudity so I was unable to go in the pool or hot tub (I did not have a bathing suit cause it was a last minute decision). To me that feels like body shaming, considering it is a women's only spa. Most of the space is taken up by couches and tables. They didn't even have tea. Definitely not worth the price. This is not a spa, it is a glorified condo recreation space. Save your shekels for some place better.

reviews.title: Do not recommend - 18% gratuity for parties of 4 or more
text: Extremely disappointed this spa is rated so highly. “Hydrotherapies” includes a pool, hot tub and sauna that fits 2 people. The sauna was not turned on when we got there at 11am and you’re also not able to go in it wet, which we realized after getting out of the hot tub. The facility is more of a lounge than a spa; 70% of the space is used for couches and chairs. My RMT, Celina Carroll was AMAZING. The best Swedish massage I’ve ever had. Tried to book four appointments online, but got the message “HTTP Error 404. The requested resource is not found.” Call to make the reservation over the phone and was surprised they had availability since all of the surrounding spas were fully booked. Found out they charge 18% gratuity for parties of 4 or more when we were paying. Absolutely outrageous considering you’re already paying 135+tax for an hour massage and NO WHERE else charges automatic gratuity. The receptionist tried to blame us for not knowing saying that the automatic gratuity is mentioned on the website – which it is NOT mentioned in the group-events section - all it says is there is a minimum of 4 for the booking and now I know why...

reviews.title: Bachelorette Day At the Spa was Lush!
text: We had a variety of treatments and all of us girls were very satisfied with our individual treatments. Lovely ambiance and place to chill, drink tea, have wine, swim in the pool and enjoy the jacuzzi.
The prices are not cheap at all (expensive). But each treatment was heavenly and treat to be enjoyed.
If I had the money I would go back regularly.
Jamie was amazing!

reviews.title: My aesthetician Cherisse, made the difference for me...and best body polish ever!
text: Cherisse is great!  We started a bit late (spa reason as I wasn't late) - but she made sure I got the full treatment.  This is the first body polish/scrub (I've had several) where my face was also included.  Also the little things made the difference - the towel under my neck, the heating pad to ensure I didn't get cold, dry brush to start (usually it hurts but not this time).  Was definitely a treat!

reviews.title: Bachelorette get together
text: We all had a really good time at the spa. The service is exceptional here. All the technicians were amazing. We had paraffin Manicures and Pedicures and enjoyed wine while being pampered. We also hung out by the pool and relaxed in the hot tub before moving on to our next destination. Overall it's a little pricy but the service was great and the amenities are very nice. I am thinking about coming back for a facial because I really enjoyed the atmosphere here.

reviews.title: Mediocre visit
text: I went for a 90 min lava shell massage and was overall not very impressed with the spa. I have been to multiple spas before and was a bit dissapointed with the amenities available. The infrared spa was only turned on when I arrived meaning it was room temperature and only began to heat up when I was ready for my massage (I arrived an hour and a half prior to my appt). The pool was on the colder side as Well. The therapist was very nice but the massage felt disjointed. I have never had a lava shell massage so I don't know if it was just the massage but every few minutes there was a pause in the massage to switch in a new, warmer shell resulting in a massage that was not continuous for the entire length. Overall the massage was 7/10 but the amentities were 5/10.

reviews.title: Great Bachelorette Day With The Girls!
text: I visited SweetGrass Spa for my friends Bachelorette party. I am the maid of honor and I actually organized everything. The group booking employee Latoya was amazing in helping me put everything together. There were 10 of us ladies. 6 had a facial and a pedicure and 4 had a massage and a pedicure. EVERYONE loved their services! No complaints at all and some of us are avid spa-goers.
I agree with some of the reviews that the pool area could use some fresh paint and/or updating but other than that everything was great.
Customer service and all staff were AMAZING! Thank you ladies!!
